Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CjE-Xi6MEHxc3bGvctOTqg.text: Took our family here while staying at the resort. The  bbq baby back ribs were very good. The Mac and cheese side was good. Two of our party ordered salads with bbq chicken the chicken was very dry and cold. The kids pizza was a poorly heated frozen one. We will not be back.

ocK_zPbJdJq8ddu5CahEbw.text: I absolutely love BBQ and Lucille's does it right! I usually order the brisket and my sides change almost every time. I like variety :)  Service is okay. Sometimes it is wonderful and sometimes it is poor, but mostly it is mediocre.  The atmosphere is great. I love the jazz music that is often playing and looking at the Southern pictures throughout the restaurant. There are jazz paintings as well. Think New Orleans. There are even Mardi Gras beads used in the decor. Part of the restaurant is called the back porch. The food is Southern style. Lots of really good food! You won't leave hungry! I plan on returning at least once a month.

s6O5feSQmXSSF-Qc6s1jFQ.text: Visited this restaurant the other day with expectations of enjoying some BBQ. I'm from Kansas City, BBQ capital of the world so my expectations were pretty high... I was sorely disappointed. I ordered the brisket, greens and mashed potatoes. The only thing I had that was remotely edible were the potatoes. The brisket was cut into small pieces and hard as wood chips. Everyone knows brisket is supposed to be thick cut and sliced not cut into small squares. Its supposed to be juicy and easy to eat. The greens were so spicy I couldn't eat them. Idk what they put in them. But... I will not be going back here. If you're looking for GOOD BBQ don't eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mEfBok5zH9w_IFCYGGiPKw.text: This is easily one of mine and my fiance favorite restaurants! We just came for our anniversary dinner on 8/30/19 and as always the food was amazing and our service even better. Special s/o to Brandon he gets an 11/10!!

TkYwuJPUbbCWHRcWtr7WUw.text: My husband and I came here tonight because we were given a gift card. We don't go out to Lucille's often but I'm glad we did. We decided to get the feast for two which includes a half appetizer or soups or salads to start, a variety of meats from chicken to ribs and we chose the tri tip as our additional meat. For our sides we got the delicious and creamy garlic mash potatoes and baked beans. At the end you get a dessert to share and we chose the chocolate cake. Not dry and quite moist. My only complaint would be the service. Our server was quite forgetful our food came out delicious and we had plenty to take home to enjoy later.

VcbG8RZ5Vq1fYcAsLqj96g.text: It's like dining in a Countryside House! The staff are Friendly and welcoming. It's located inside the beautiful Red Rock Casino. I tried the BBQ Chicken with Corn on the Cobb which was very delicious.

NZdjVlEtINErFBsdiSPWkg.text: Went to Lucille's for dinner with my wife. She's from Kansas City (known for its BBQ) and I'm from Georgia. Needless to say, our expectations were pretty high. Sadly, we were disappointed. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with mac and cheese. The pork was so greasy that the bun started to fall apart. The mac and cheese was watered down and worse than Kraft. My wife ordered brisket, mashed potatoes, and greens. The brisket was dry and the greens were way too spicy. Not only was our food almost inedible, the prices are ridiculous. We spent $45 for the both of us. We could've spent $15 at Chick-fil-A and been satisfied.  Sorry but we are never returning.

9Z3ou9kodNwLP0ikP2uz-w.text: I sat at the bar this visit ... the service is wonderful and very attentive. I could see the wait staff was very accommodating today .... this has been my experience every time at Lucille's other than my previous visit .... food is still very good !!! I am very happy I came back!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. She loves the strawberry lemonade!!
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt ends salad!
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The rolls are great ... the flavored butter is fantastic

JkeDr1vtvHoFRttZqEidiw.text: Upon arriving at Lucille's, we encountered a short wait, which the host was great on keeping us updated on. After sitting, we ordered the lunch special deviled eggs. Presentation was awful; looked like something someone whipped up at home. The filling was not developed enough in taste, all that stood out was mustard flavor--could've used more herbs. The consistency was also thinner than I would like. The wedge salad had outside layers that were already soft, alongwith presentation lacking as well since the topping had peeled away at the wedge. As for entrees, the baby back ribs were SMALL. I had 3 bones the size of my pinky. If I did not get the 2-meat combo that also consisted of the St. Louis Ribs, I would definitely have asked for a manager. How do you expect those 3 bones to be a complete meal if someone were to get those by itself? I've had a better rack from Whole Foods. The glaze was beautiful on the ribs though, flavorful without extra bbq needed. Biscuits were very soft and moist! The potato salad was not my type, it had a pronounced mustard taste. I don't think I would come back to this location, maybe the Henderson one.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby back on the left, St. Louis on the right
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sloppy presentation for the deviled eggs
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad

Zm-iI2b03DBR6OxDGekWMg.text: This is the first Lucille's  in Las Vegas to try for lunch on a Saturday in December. It's located in the Red Rock between Yard House and Heatherstone. I came with hubby and friend to try this Lucille's at 11am. The place is huge in size and includes a music stage for music band. The menu looks different for Lucille's in California. The menu prices seem higher in price. I ordered a tri tip sandwich with bake potato and peach ice tea. Our waitress was very good on refills and kept checking on us. The tri tip sandwich was delicious and not dry in a bun. The bake potato was delicious with everything on it. The waitress said the bake potato is back to serve during lunch. Yay good news. Plenty of parking.

uOv3ddcQAykQFi75KxC8Wg.text: Update to last review of 2103. We arrived earlier than our reservation time and the staff set up our table and seated us in a few minutes. Service was friendly and efficient with our server Ashlee checking on us throughout. The baby back ribs have vastly improved The ribs were much larger and meatier. They were cooked perfectly to fall of the bone tender. The pulled pork was tender and with a nice Memphis style sauce. For my taste no additional sauce was required for the ribs or pulled pork. The sides of cole slaw and baked beans were the perfect complement to the BBQ    The portions of meat were large enough to provide a second meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby Back Ribs
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby Back Ribs &amp; Pulled Pork

3Jl1bcpOEK9RRSn14kVSsA.text: In a nutshell, 5 minutes into sitting down, a drink was accidentally spilled onto my newborn baby, shattered glass and all. So, there's that.   However, I must say that my disappointment with this visit has nothing to do with the spilt drink, accidents happen and that's totally understandable, really. What was disappointing was managements lack of trying to make up for it. Sure, they apologized more that we could count. But I feel like if a manager had to pull out her phone to use the flashlight to check for glass on my ONE MONTH old baby, that our meal should have have been comped. Or, a free dessert, AT MINIMUM. Receiving a full priced meal after an accident that could have ended much worse was shocking, to say the least. We would have at least liked to have had the opportunity to turn down a discounted meal. Regardless, accidents happen and we tipped our waitress the same as if the service was perfect.   Our meal was mediocre - as expected - and the managers lack of compensation was unfortunate.

_IO7v3iCjv9TByUKHvI5nQ.text: The most terrible experience ever. We checked in at 5:30pm and let them know there will be a party of 20 people. They had reserved seats for us and since only half our party was there they gave the seats away. That's understandable. When the rest of our party came around 6, they stated we had to wait for the party to leave and should be soon. There was an entire back section open and available in which they said was reserved for others who previously called and made a reservation. So one hour passed and at 7pm we were quite upset and asked to speak to a manager. We went back and forth to say the least. One employee (ashley) said with a snarky attitude "if you don't like it, go to yard house!" (Next door) then she proceeded to storm out running into my nieces (ages 6-11) on her way to the front door. So after more than 1.5 hours of waiting and our children being physically harmed we left and ate at the food court inside the hotel.   Terrible customer we service!!!!!!!

PiNUMAODNTQYD-e6C5EfCg.text: Service 1 out of 5, food 5 out of 5. The service has never been good any of the 15 plus times we have been here in the past three years. Not once has it even been OK service actually- Ask for extra sauces when you order and you will not get them, ask when they don't bring them and they still never come out. Ask for a different side than a meal comes with and you likely won't get it, but the wait time for food is not worth asking them to fix it. Food takes a VERY long time to come out- a stupid amount of time- regardless of time of day, how busy(or not busy) it is, or the amount of staff working. You might see your waiter/waitress once for refills and once to check in for the 1.5 hours you're basically forced spend here for a party of 5.   MAKE A RESERVATION FOR LARGE PARTIES OR ON WEEKENDS!!!! It will be a super long wait otherwise. Probably close to 45 minutes without a reservation on a weekend night for a family size (4-6 ppl) party.  The food is UH-MAZING. I've never had a menu item or drink I didn't like. The ONLY reason we come back time and time again!!! We do take out more often then dine in- I suggest that route over done-in ANY day.

9SaPT8Km_8f-cebA1zirnA.text: Texas born and raised, we definitely miss good bbq. The Smokey kind is the best. I'll be honest, I only give four stars because sometimes the service is not the greatest. Actually we have walked out due to waiting 15 minutes for our waiter to come and wait on us. Our waitress definitely redeemed our last few experiences. She took our full order but our food arrived perfectly. The biscuits arrived nice and hot. The cinnamon butter melted in seconds. Just as we were trying to lick the plate clean from the yummy brisket nachos, our big beautiful beef ribs came out. We ordered 2 baked potatoes and a side salad. They even brought an extra side of ranch. We didn't ask for it but a definite bonus. The beef ribs had the perfect amount of smoke. We think the ribs beat out some of our favorite spots in Texas. When a Texas family doesn't need to add on any bbq sauce, you know the meat is good! Well done Lucille's! The hot towel is a great ending to our meal & the waitress hooked me up with the best glass of to go peach tea. Perfect Sunday! I look forward to changing my review to 5 stars if they can be consistent with the service & I'd be really, really happy if they would bring the homemade potato chips back. Those were the best things ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best to go peach tea ever! Thanks to our amazing server.
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &amp; a tootsie pop to boot!
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This plate doesn&#39;t do the size justice. Don&#39;t you wish this picture was scratch and taste? Yum!!!

dbD8mPtyHn_q8QXWy_qspg.text: The only positive thing I have to say is that our server was awesome! However, I was very disappointed to say the least. The chicken was just ok. No complaints tho. The burnt ends were very dry and only got about 7 small pieces. The spicy sausage was good but immediately after eating it I got sick to my stomach and had to rush home. The sides were by far the worse I've ever eaten. I got the Mac and cheese and garlic mashed potatoes. The Mac and cheese was very dry and had no flavor. The mashed potatoes were very bland as well. My son, who loves ribs, was also disappointed and kept saying how we should have went to famous Dave's instead. A friend recommended this place and I figured I try some place new for my birthday with my family. Needless to say, it was the worse $150 we've ever spent. I hate to write such a negative review but my advice is to save your money and go to famous Dave's or even chili's whi has better bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Iuqjt9qyhlU9Pg5hIpEwxg.text: Love the ambiance!!! We came on a Saturday night and they have a live band performing. Love the blues they were playing.   For starters, ordered our drinks; the mojito was sweet and minty. So refreshing!  We had the complimentary biscuits and apple butter.  We were in a low carb diet but hubby and I devoured these warm delicious biscuits ( with the promise we have to work out the next day) but it was so worth the calories. Go slow on the appetizers as they come in large servings-- we had the crunchy onion straws and the tortilla chips with spinach & cheese dip. We were almost getting full when our entrees arrived.  The barbecues we ordered were whole slab of baby back ribs (really moist and tender) tri tips and beef brisket. Finger licking good! We didn't even have to use the sauces on the table as the barbecues were very flavorful already. The sides were Mac & Cheese, greens, corn on a cob, baked beans, slaw & watermelon; all the sides go very well with the BBQs.  Our server was very attentive and nice.   Overall, happy with this and all previous visits. The place to go to when we're craving for slow cooked BBQs!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Birthday Cake!
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef brisket with corn on a cob &amp; baked beans
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full rack of barbecue ribs, Mac &amp; Cheese and greens.

onYpbzPYxgsGVcT3qkkG7A.text: Great food. Happened to be some live music the night I ate there.  The food is great and they have some of the best biscuits Ive ever had.  Im from the South if that tells you anything. Huge portions were a plus as well!

FVLurcP3fpOQP4YJx7SaOw.text: I have been to Lucille's many times at other location but just recently became aware of  this location. For people that like BBQ Lucille's is a great chain restaurant. However this Lucille's is very inconsistent compared to other locations. I have been here twice and my orders have been messed up both times and things like the biscuits were under cooked and the ribs were overcooked. However the staff was nice just disorganized took a incredibly long time to get a refill etc. Very nice restaurant with nice windows facing a fountain however the food quality control needs some major help. Extra star for cleanliness and location however this Lucille's is not consistent with the other locations.

woFfMh6shvK9_ylMU8z4SQ.text: Ok, so I'll admit it..it was my first time. ..and it won't be my last ;) Eating at this Bbq heaven I say! !!  Ok, waitress was very lingering. .felt like she wanted to braid my hair and feed me every morsel of my food. .UGG.. Food was beyond delicious, wait time was a lil more than we had expected,  but my husband and I had no other obligations. Because this establishment is still in its infancy,  im sure it will get better in time. A word of business advice. ..hire older, well established staff for a brand new restaurant. .not the teen bops currently standing around in that beautiful new restaurant :) With that said, I will be back. .

wEfbCfBYTAzDn6F8_wDV5w.text: Absolutely amazing. Ate here for Father's Day and fell in love. The food isn't rushed, the flavor is explosive, and the strawberry lemonade that comes served in old fashion mason jars is UNBELIEVABLY GREAT!   The atmosphere and service was also a major major plus! I'd recommend eating here for any occasion. Very reasonably priced menu might I add.

hyZwKC5fy87aMnTBCB5bkw.text: Brisket nachos were amazing! Came here for a late lunch on vacation. Staff is friendly. Good service. Decent drink menu.

ZCG1fo-W0oR180KQXHNQhQ.text: Went in on a slow Wednesday night with a comp from the casino for $30. I'd never dined in here before so I didn't know what to expect. The atmosphere is acceptable, some cool artistic things around the restaurant but I didn't spend a lot of time looking at it.  They bring sodas out in huge mason jars - which is perfect because I drink them very quickly. I ordered their signature soup, a corn chowder. I wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was. Seriously - best corn chowder ever. EVER. Perfect balance of sweet and salty, lots of veggies too. Server brought out some biscuits as well, and they were just okay, maybe a little dry but the sweet sugar butter they serve with it is yummy.  For my entree I had the half chicken - served with 2 sides; I chose mashed potatoes and macaroni and cheese, all of it was very good and the chicken was not dry at all, the skin was slightly crispy from the grill and had a very good BBQ sauce on it. All that for only $25  Dessert looked good but I was far too full.  Server was super nice, very attentive.

b04CgHsJ-czPbfM6vvlJHw.text: Excellent as usual. Best ribs, great sides. Exceptional service. Locational was very convenient for locals too.

yU3WBXgW-iCkyjqRS6KOHg.text: The food was pretty good!  The waiter Reno was super nice and very attentive!  I thought the prices were a little high.

exBk4k86E3piMneN4pSBAg.text: As far as chain Bar-B-Que goes I have always preferred Lucille's over Famous Dave's so I am happy one finally opened in my neighborhood.  Their honey butter is addicting!  Our waiter, Christopher, was friendly and knowledgeable as far as the drink and regular menu was concerned.  He didn't steer me wrong with the Minty Julep with Gentleman Jack and the Crocodile.  I ordered the half rack with two sides.  I feel the price is a little high but that's to be expected with a chain Bar-B-Que establishment.  The whole table loved the shredded onion appetizer.  We went on a Friday night around 7, party of three, and had no problem being seated.  I would like to go back and try their Happy Hour in the bar so maybe next visit.

Sli9SdPTvEPYAgBSHzN2SQ.text: A bit pricey but we walked out very full.  Mardi gras chicken was great and chicken plus 2 meats was great - brisket pieces were fantastic!

MT5mDpDOPoSQnVhwFWHDZg.text: Lucille's is the perfect southern comfort food restaurant.  I've been to both this location and the Green Valley location. Obviously the Green Valley location has been around a longer and has service down pat. This Red Rock location is still working on things, but they're not doing too bad.  The portion sizes are huge, so you can easily share a two meat dish with someone. You both will need to be extremely hungry to finish it. My favorite dishes are the southern fried chicken and the brisket. My favorite sides include mashed potatoes and cole slaw. And you can't go wrong with fried pickles as an appetizer. Want a cocktail? Those are also delish!

lwTQvN6ENKn0RD5Nwyt0xQ.text: Just had the absolute worst experience here. My boyfriend and I just had lunch. I'm a vegetarian and I understand that this is a BBQ place so I asked the host if there were any vegetarian options. She told me the two items so we asked to be seated. She was very nice. Our waitress came and took our order. I got the portobello sandwich and explained that I am vegetarian. Got the French fries too. She brought the biscuits after. Lots of places use animal fat so I wanted to make sure these didn't have any. I asked the woman waiting the table behind us because ours was no where in sight. She said she didn't know and would go ask for me. After she walked past the table a few times we assumed she wasn't going to answer. Then the manager brought our food to our table. So I asked him, he went and checked and came back in one minute. He was very nice. We were talking about how the chips in lots of places fry then in the oil they cook the chicken in. While eating the fries. We decided to ask and our waitress said oh yeah I didn't even think of that when you ordered. So I just stopped eating. Needless to say I would not recommend this place to anyone who may not want to eat a particular food. They don't care about your allergy or preference. If you will eat anything, I'd say stop by, I hear the food is pretty good.

_t8c4JnEvpHNGrLsH8fSBw.text: Amazing food horrible service. The manager of this place needs to get some secret shoppers and improve the service. So many employees and not many say hello or they will be right with you. Stood at the to go line 5 minutes and no one asked if they could help or that someone would be right with me. Sad because the food is awesome .

iaRweHmFmLAMUs0Raqzvcg.text: Clean fast and great table service Brett was on point. The food was good I had the fried chicken I was pretty disappointed not a good version of it chicken was juicy the veggies were hot the mash potatoes and gray were great but the breading on the chicken and the seasoning not to great. overall great experience and good costumer service

LYKSnSbJazaJii34A8bD1A.text: I take my team out  to lunch here once in a while. They are always able to accommodate our large group without much notice. Love the BBQ and the sides. Love the atmosphere. Food is well priced and we always enjoy the lunch menu.

as4gBIO-f-MjQBK3EuAMZA.text: Love the potatoe chip appetizers. I had the Catfish, grits and greens.  Ir was delicious.  Hubby had the Tri-tip sandwich.  Boys had burger and Shrimp with steak.  We all enjoyed the atmosphere and meal.

NtCKzZND0I3aBNbW-mJtew.text: The last time we were here my husband and I were not too impressed with food but there was a long wait at the buffet so we decided to try it one more time.  Our server Kayleigh was amazing!!! She gave us wonderful service and the food was much better this time around.  If you have a craving for BBQ food and are in the area go to Lucille's and ask for Kaleigh.

XiHGbpo7JXsTPdTr7fYYeA.text: I would give 0 stars if I could. I had a large party come in that was ready to spend money and because it was close to closing, the staff was talking crap about my party. Instead of telling us that our group would not be sitting together they just prepared the table and argued with us when we asked why they didn't tell us. They were rude and inconsiderate. The restaurant missed out on a $600 plus sale.

YPJNmd5T36VIhy4wqLCSYw.text: To start off, the Peach Moon was excellent! I love Blue Moon and this is a drink that takes this beer to a whole new level.   Our server was Anthony was very attentive, my girlfriend kept telling me how cute he was. (Awkward I know) He suggested the tri tip and pasilla sandwich and that is what I ended up getting.  BEST SANDWICH EVER. We will be coming back asap! I also like this location more than the GV location. Much more open and friendly environment.

vN5rAlsm9oGfUnjkGaXRjQ.text: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE experience.     Long story that isn't worth the time to get into b/c I wouldn't go back to this place.   Please DO NOT mistake this for the Lucille's in Henderson which I actually love.  But this place is run by a bunch of idiots and the stupidity trickles down through all of the employees that we dealt with.    Showed up and told the hostess that we were there for happy hour (for the food).  We had 2 young kids with us so sat us in a booth just outside the bar area but technically in the main dining area.  Settled in... got daughter #1 in a booster seat and daughter #2 stayed in her car seat so had to adjust the booth a bit to get her to fit in... but took a few minutes to get settled.    Waiter comes and takes our drink order.   We ask about the happy hour menu for some appetizers and he says that happy hour is only in the bar area.  We explained to the waiter that we told the hostess that we were there for happy hour.  So we asked if kids were allowed in the bar area.  He said that they were.    So we looked around and there were maybe 4 or 5 other tables occupied in the entire place as it was an off time of the day... maybe 3 pm or so.  So we simply asked if it was really a big deal for them to make us move our kids, drinks, menus and all of that stuff.   He said that happy hour needed to be rung up in the bar.  So we just asked if he could just ring our order in at the bar.  He said that he wasn't allowed b/c of his manager.  We asked if we could speak with the manager.  He tracked down his manager within earshot of our table and we heard the manager basically tell him that wasn't an option and he wasn't going to come all the way over to our table to tell us that....  of course he had a bit of an attitude that he was being asked such a crazy request.  So the waiter came back to tell us what he said and we stopped him and said that we want to talk to the manager... so we insisted that he actually make him come over to talk with us.  We repeated our request to the manager and explained that we weren't trying to be difficult but seems like a fairly simple problem with a fairly simple solution.  So he gave us the line that if he makes an exception for us... then he needs to make an exception for everybody...  so again... we look around the restaurant to see the 4 or 5 other tables that were occupied which were all in the bar except for 1 couple finishing up a couple tables away from us.  I explained that there wasn't anyone else in the bar to worry about and thought it was silly that a "manager" cannot make a basic customer service decision like this.  He insisted that it was not possible....  So my wife and I debated whether we wanted to move to a new table or just leave.  Again... with 2 kids and a hot day... just decided to move to another table since we were starving.     So we get a new waitress b/c it is her section and she chooses to make sarcastic remarks from the very beginning about us having issues.   Took our order and gave us the bare minimum in terms of service.   We had to flag down random people for drink refills and the food came out all at once (appetizers and main course)   Food wasn't prepared well... but what's the point of complaining at this point.  So we laughed it off... got sarcastic with the waitress towards the end... left her a big fat Zero for a tip and won't be back.    It is crazy what a night and day difference the Red Rock location is versus the Henderson location.   And for what it's worth....  it seems that we get poor service at just about every restaurant at the Red Rock Casino which is disappointing b/c it is such a nice place.   But seriously.... 10 years I have been in town and probably 5 or 6 restaurants there have consistently bad service.  This has been the worst by far!

X0RT2y8D6Z-wWiolzMPHDw.text: First the food and the wait staff were very good! But for the second time - the hostess and seating system  for this Lucille's is the worst.  It doesn't help that the waiting area is exceptionally small but the way the hostess group handles the waiting guests is a joke.  We felt like we being hurdled like cattle in a small area with no communication with the guests from the staff. We had a Reservation and still had to  wait 20 minutes for our table.  NO communication about when we were to be seated.  Not only our party but many other guests were saying the same thing.  This has happened to us twice at this Lucilles - and as a result this will be our last visit.

Ef8XN7fOBW9QJSdnOKdzWw.text: Lucilles is listening! We skipped last years thanksgiving meal and made our own because 2016 dinner was not good from here. (See review) This year we decided to cater from them again for thanksgiving dinner and OMG the food was absolutely perfect. Creamy mashed potatoes and sweet potatoes, they added a vegetable side of green beans (I hate green bean casserole and this was way better!) tons of turkey and ham smoked to perfection, regular fluffy biscuits, sweet potato pie, stuffing that was not spicy at all, gravy, and cranberry sauce. Very very good! Hats off to the chefs who prepared it this year because it was prepared perfectly. Our guests really enjoyed the food and I enjoyed not having to cook. Worth every penny. ($200 for the entire feast.) I will cater from them again next year for turkey day. $400 for two whole turkey dinners to feed a party of 20 with plenty of leftovers for the UofM & OSU game the following day! Soooo worth it.

YDcGgmar0QTBN21rZZCFNw.text: I'm always here for lunch and the seafood chicken gumbo... dont forget the coupon if u are a station casino borders member!!!

jbx_XqjWldvIX53Z7YvGSg.text: Quiet and with a sense of southern backyard charm, I was pleasantly surprised the people-thirtsy Lucille's had such tasty food. Although on the expensive side, I thought of this BBQ joint similar to Olive Garden with its Italian food: affordable and fancy, but not gourmet.  You are offered their complimentary biscuits and cinnamon butter. I was not a fan of said butter. It made the already sweet biscuits sweeter. If you have children with an appetite, please, allow them to indulge at least. My waitress was gracious and efficient, quickly offering me my drink options ($3 for the largest Mason jar you've ever seen! Reminded me of Memphis, TN BBQ). No complaints there. It was after I ordered my food that it seemed to take ages for it to arrive. I felt the staff may have lost my request and kept anxiously glancing over towards the kitchen.  When you start running out of conversational topics, biscuit to stuff your face with AND you pull out your phone to start watching the latest episode of a series you're into, you know the wait was bad.  Lucille's smokes their meat in-house in a smoker right smack in the middle of the floor. My waitress was kind enough to inform me that I would taste the gaseous fumes, which I expected. Overall, the food was delicious and filling. Not only was everything fresh and well thought out, warm towels were brought out to satisfactorily clean my hands. Definitely beats the moist towelettes you get at other establishments.  Stop on in for a touch of Southern charm. Yee-haw!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed baked potato and salad lunch special. You will need a doggie bag for this big boy.
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fried chicken lunch special. Same batter is used on the fried pickles. Definitely rib sticking food!
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried pickles. Fresh and very tasty.

saOjLNEb3PlYrt2bMNT8Ng.text: Great BBQ restaurant located inside Red Rock Casino. I ordered the Texas beef brisket with macaroni & cheese and baked beans. While I was disappointed with the baked beans, the macaroni & cheese was probably the best I've ever had. And the brisket was excellent!

iHKlWR6k7aHzjMMv7irD8w.text: Simply put, walked in, was told there was a 20 minute wait for a table but there was a high top available. We sat at it. 10 minutes. No one. Plenty of help walked past, no service. Meanwhile plenty of booths were available around us. Go back to the front and point out we haven't had anyone stop by in 10 minutes, and there were booths everywhere. Told us to wait a few minutes.   Nah.   Writing this from Yard House next door. Sat immediately, serviced immediately. Sad too, I was in the mood for BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the drink that came to us in 2 minutes next door.

mAQPKj-t9leLp05czUZR0w.text: My favorite place for ribs. Sides are pretty good as well. Food is heavy which i like. Always have a good time here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribd

w19DW9Zv3q9phJXb167r3w.text: Stopped in to take advantage of happy hour.  We were seated in a booth - not given a choice - happy hour menu was ON our table but told we could not order happy hour because we were not in the bar ?!?  So we asked to be moved to the bar and ordered happy hour appetizers.  Guys - don't put a menu on my table if I can't order from it.  Once we got reseated in the bar area where we could enjoy the happy hour discount we thoroughly enjoyed the food and drinks.    Deducting ONE star for the large happy hour special.  Started off poorly but made up with the BBQ.

Pl4fFb6fgdDsNHsullCu0A.text: there are some good BBQ spots in LV but i always choose Lucille's over the other ones just because of their biscuits. I don't know if they changed the recipe or what has happened, but the past 3-4 times i've ordered delivery from Lucille's, the biscuits have been terrible (i usually get an order of 6). They have been stale, hard, and dry every time. I can't even cut the biscuit in half without it crumbling into my hands. I am a die hard fan of these biscuits, and they have just been such a disappointment the last few times i've ordered them. I highly doubt these are being served to the customers who are dining in.. please, Lucille's, stop giving your old, dry, hard biscuits to those ordering delivery from you!!

trbsnsdaBEWlmLsYd3OA7A.text: Delicious food! Ribs were fall off the bone good and the garlic mashed potatoes were amazing

sE9IIRmOfkt-xC_Sc0AhYw.text: TL:DR crowd - served MOLDY grilled cheese, sub par service and still paid for 70% even though everyone lost their appetites and didn't eat half their food.  We've been to the GVR location of Lucille's before and had a lovely time with great food and fantastic service.   No brainer when we wanted a great place to go for a birthday!  The Red Rock Casino Lucille's was much closer to where we are staying this time, so we chose that location.   We called about 2 hours in advance for an 8:30 seating for 8 people. We were seated around 8:45. We watched them clean the tables and then stay empty 5 minutes so we begged them to seat us as the 3 younger kids were taking up space in the super small indoor entrance and causing some traffic flow issues.   The waiter took our order about 10 minutes later. Drinks arrived and our shoestring onions (tasty!!) arrived 15 minutes after that.   Our food trailed in 20 minutes later in shifts. We got 3 plates (and a salad that was an appetizer added to a meal) and then a few minutes later, 4 more trickled in. The birthday girl was last to receive her food a good 5 minutes after the rest of us.   She had only taken a few bites when we realized one of the kids was chowing down on a MOLDY grilled cheese sandwich.   We asked the bartender for a manager. She took 10 minutes to arrive. She listened to us then said she wanted to take the bread back to have the kitchen manager check it. Five or so minutes later, she came back stating she gave us a sizable discount and took the kid's grilled cheese off.   The birthday girl ate two bites and the rest of us had half the food on their plates and didn't want to eat another bite. 30% off. Our bill went from around $160 to $99 and we have 8 people half full and one very angry kid who got a sandwich taken away from him. (The manager did not show us a receipt or tell us an amount. She had the waiter deliver it a few minutes later and we never saw her again.)  Subpar service and terrible quality control. Don't know if we will return because that thought will always be lingering.   What a sad birthday dinner!

The restaurant is well spaced out. And management seemed to be well involved. I will be recommending to friends since it was so enjoyable.

Am9n0kMsZFGuUy1Co0rjvg.text: Loved the salmon there and live band also !! Great time, great food and great drinks that's a winning combination !

zd96SvXjJDWi0XrWU0Fexw.text: My wife and I try to go out to lunch, just us, while the kids are in school, at least once a week.  (Insert the song  - T'Aint Nobody's Business If I Do by Otis Spann (1930 - 1970))  We walked through the Red Rock Casino and Resort to the casino entrance. We noticed a sign asking patrons to go to the other hostess station to be seated. While walking to the OTHER SIDE of the restaurant we were greeted by someone "who would be happy to seat us." Only to have that person turn around and seat us at the nearest booth... how convienent.  (Insert the song  - Born Under A Bad Sign by Albert King (1923 -1992))  The atmosphere was fine, loved the decorations, love the music being played. Part of the decor included fake trees in one section of the dining room. Which led me to wonder how much dust has collected on the leaves. How often are the leaves actually cleaned?  (Insert the song  - Dust My Broom by Elmore James (1918 - 1963))  The food was fine by me. I had some chicken and brisket which is a staple in my diet. But no sooner would I server come by and ask how things are doing, a manager or such would ask the same two minutes later. Felt kinda over done.   (Insert the song  - Got To Be Some Changes Made by Otis Rush (b. 1934))  All in all everything was real good. But it was the little things that added up and made me want to leave one star off my review. Would I return to Lucille's? Let me answer that by saying...  (Insert the song -  One more now, Lucille Sounds pretty good to me, can I do one more? Look out, Lucille Sounds really good, I think I'll try one more, alright -  B.B. King (1925 - 2015))

k9TUrd2k7vMAhAOD-KEjVQ.text: The biscuits were the main reason we came! And they didn't let me down! They were great. I did also get the BBQ salad, which was rather large! The one area for improvement was the lack of BBQ sauce, but maybe that is what made it healthy. But if you're looking for a large salad, this is the one!

9TDSY65zl7y7FwThsukT7Q.text: This is my first visit but I anticipate coming back soon.  I have never been here before but was given a gift card for this establishment.  Today was busy; however, we were seated quickly and didn't have to wait long to begin our order.  I decided to try the Apple Martini, which was lovely! Next, I had the Corn Chowder soup which was off the chain good and then I ordered the bbq brisket sandwich, cole slaw and garlic mashed potatoes.  Everything was prepared just right and was extremely filling. Our waitress was very tentative to our questions and pleasant.  She was knowledgeable about the menu.  If you are in town or visiting, you should stop in at this location because I thoroughly enjoyed myself.

WX5jucgy5sfeIMk3AdgFJQ.text: I LOVE Lucille's and have been very happy they opened one here so you don't have to drive all the way down to henderson. My biggest complaint is that the rest aran smells smokey since it's inside the red rock casino. I wonder if there would be less smoke if the restaurant was fully closed instead of being somewhat open to the casino, oh and there are no bathrooms here, you must got out into the casino and find a bathroom, wish there was a sign cause I went on a long journey to find one when there was one to my left walking out that I didn't see until going back. Anywho....  GET THE SWEET TEA. I love me some diabetes tea. The there biscuits are so good with the apple butter. Mmmmm. I could eat a dozen of those. Bbq is good, now I haven't had real Texas bbq, but I'd imagine this is close. I love the spicier bbq sauce that they have on the table. Usually get the tri tip sandwich with Mac and cheese, the apps are delish, and pretty much everything I have had is bomb. The one thing I hate is how busy this place is and there always seems to be a wait to get in. There is a live band so parts of the restaurant gets really loud, but that's part of the feel. Don't forget your tootsie pop on the way out!

DH3d6Vt6dll5DyazYDgY7g.text: This is the second time we have tried to eat here.  We were told there was a long wait even though there were numerous open tables.  When i inquired about the open tables the section i was inquiring about was closed.  That was interesting to say the least as there were two tables in that same section were people were seated eating. Again this the same thing we were told the last time we tried to eat there and there were open/empty tables.  We left and took our business to another resturant. Needless to say we wont try again to eat there.

imYvl5uTy0DWG_C-5Jxv5Q.text: Saturday nights are special since they feature live blues in the evening. How much fun is that! Add a drink, yummy bbq and their hot and spicy bbq sauce for me, outrageous! Oh yeah, their sweet sugared biscuits, its my dessert.  Great service. Dependable food. Great music. Perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq &amp; live blues
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too sweet watermelon margarita and live blues

8A2bVL9rvu3mySf9IX0LxQ.text: HAIR WAS IN MY NACHOS !!!!!!!!!   I came here for what was supposed to be my birthday and had HAIR in my nachos instead. Of course the manager ROSE took the nachos off the bill and "spoke with the chef " BUT I still will be calling the health department . This is disgusting! Las Vegas really needs to do better HANDLING FOOD !!!!!!

uvmJVZdHAJX1DTF6fGOw8Q.text: We came here on a company lunch celebrating our boss' birthday.  The atmosphere of this place gave me instant nostalgia from all the BBQ joints in Nashville.  I got the burnt ends Lunch Special with a side of Mac & Cheese. The burnt ends portion was small as expected, but with how flavorful it was, I felt full and satisfied at the end. The mac and cheese wasn't overly greasy which was a surprise. Great balance of flavors where nothing in it was overwhelming the other. Service was excellent as well. Not too overbearing not too unattentive, just right.  However, I had 2 issues with the biscuits. My first impression of a lot of Southern food joints starts with the biscuits. The biscuits are a reflection of how the food will taste. On these biscuits, they put a LOT of sugar on the bottom and on the top of it. It was too sweet for me, so I had to scrape as much sugar off as I could. When I was scraping off the bottom of a second biscuit, I noticed that there was a small metal thing that probably came from where the biscuits are packaged.  They were nice about it though and took my meal off the check.  Overall, the BBQ is great, the biscuits are sweet, and the small thing in the biscuit was a little worrying.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small metal thing embedded in the bottom of one of the biscuits while scraping the excess sugar away
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt ends

2nVXlRadI7jjcIWNYFL5aw.text: We are locals so we really wanted to like the ribs here  as we live 1 mile away. Unfortunately all our  ribs were too dry and when we mentioned it to the waitress she said no one else complained so basically it's our problem. We will not return as they don't seem concerned with locals which makes sense since they are in red rock Casino where they have constant tourists.  Since I posted this review the manager has contacted me and offered to send a gift certificate. They do seem to care about repeat business and I appreciate them  reaching out. It speaks highly of them.

VpNLffER-UgHwtxVpjQjwA.text: Having a late lunch in Lucille spa to try the new southern peach bread pudding and Ashley the bartender said it was awesome and wonderful and yummy so I can't wait to try it

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

Vqfhh8QgkI6jmGo-Y6jO0A.text: I really like this location more than the one at the District. Guess I am biased, being a Summerlin resident. I like the ambiance. I like that it is spacious. The bar is in the middle. There are lots of TV's for your viewing pleasure, if you're into sports. The side facing the front of the casino, near the parking lot, has the hostess station. The side open to the casino is technically the back. We've sat on both ends of the restaurant. The side fronting the parking lot, has a more entertainment feel because there is a small stage. The part in the middle of those two sections is near the gigantic smoker. The side towards the casino has a dining room feel. (If you need to go to the bathroom, it's just outside of the restaurant, in the casino.) Music is playing, in the background, but the noise level isn't too bad, either.   Love the biscuits and the butter. Our son loves it too. (When you have a picky child and he finds some favorites, we're happy.) We enjoy two dishes here very much, which is why we've gotten the same thing the last two visits (twice in January), brisket nachos and gumbo. Our son loves the gumbo. Full of flavor. Nice generous portions, big enough to share, for now, our son's six years old. It was funny, our son just noticed that the water comes in jugs (supposed to be like canning jars).  The staff and service is great. And the manager always stops by to check on every table too. Clean restaurant.

Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We&#39;re in the middle

9TD5EOTpJfvEOkw11F1IiQ.text: Wow, has to be one of the best bbq joints I've dined at in years! The service was fantastic and the portions are insanely huge! Red Rock Casino has a well established restaurant nestled inside and I recommend anything they have on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order of Onion Straws, which looks more like a full order.

cP1ACcqrRtL6lMB2z_Yuaw.text: My wife and I enjoyed an early dinner at Lucilles. The food was exemplary! We made an order for our child and when the food arrived we realized we made a mistake on his order.  We could see the staff discussing the issue in the back and looking to our table. The waitress said it would be "about 20 minutes" to make his cheeseburger and didnt some happy about it at all. As my wife and I ate our meals, his food came and it was fine. I asked for a cup of water to go from the manager and our waitress was sure to let me know how she felt about our table. I wont be coming back to this location because it makes me uncomfortable that people have an attitude with their JOB. Forget you and your service. Foods great, you suck. It's your job to serve and if you dont like serving pick a new industry.

aon2kZ4cQHgC51XYDmqt6A.text: For casino food this is pretty good but for BBQ joints, I've had much better.   Located inside Red Rock Casino, it was a good option during a weeklong stay for a business trip. It was convenient and fast, but I wouldn't drive out of my way to go here.

duLZHicvnMXfww_WWA8-Hw.text: ***UPDATE:  Went last night. Suddenly the prices went way up! Not a good idea when locals are iso a nice bbq place. Now you're spending $65+ for two ppl. One appetizer a side & a plate w/2 waters?! Then as I sat down at my table I hear a server I saw her name tag but won't post her name ("A") tells a manager "I wish you could just send them all away-Tell everyone to just go home!"...Wow so you want all of your customers to go home? Don't you want money?! I assume you're not rich & working for tips just for "fun" -very disappointing to hear waitstaff wanting us all to go home. Immediately put a huge damper on our meal. We also had no salt & pepper or the 3 bbq sauces on our table so my guest had to get up & get them all himself. 2 waitresses sat there & watched him do it. I really do not appreciate customers having to do work while lazy servers hang out & talk about who's getting cut when & what sides did you do. Ugh!  I didn't have an enjoyable meal after the prices went to $30 for a two meats plate & her rude unprofessional comment. I guess we will go find another bbq place to go to as a Summerlin resident instead.   The flavors were all smoked and they had a variety of meat cuts- beef ribs, brisket, chicken, sausage etc. we got the deal for two ppl ($49) 3-4 meats w two sides and cheesecake for dessert. I'm stuffed. In a good way lol. 3 diff bbq sauces. Carolina style vinegar yellow mustard based. Regular and sweet/spicy. Mac n cheese was decent potato salad was decent I'm picky bc I make my own homemade white truffle Mac n cheese lol. Overall good size space, plenty of TVs & friendly waitstaff. I'll be back when I'm craving some bbq. The only thing I can't stand is the red Bucket of mystery dirty water that the heat used to clean off my table. Please use one time only cleaning supplies. Sooo many germs on those rags. Blah. Otherwise no other complaints :)
